intro: Acetosella hirsutissima, commonly known as hairy wood sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in woodland areas, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening. Acetosella hirsutissima is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
